name: Blue Is The Colour Quiz | UK Football Teams | 10 Questions

questions.text: What year brought 'The Blues' their only English championship title to date?
questions.explanation:
1955.

	Although coming close on a few occasions since, these perennial underachievers have not managed another title.

questions.text: Who was Chelsea's manager in their title winning season?
questions.explanation:
Ted Drake.

	Ted, managed this great feat with a squad of mostly English players, who would believe it.

questions.text: Which goalie played 729 games for Chelsea, keeping 208 clean sheets in that time?
questions.explanation:
Peter Bonetti.

	Peter's nickname was 'The Cat'. He was England's understudy to Gordon Banks in the World Cups of 1966 and 1970.

questions.text: What striker that was signed from Reading in 1983 became the second highest Chelsea scorer?
questions.explanation:
Kerry Dixon.

	Kerry scored 147 goals in 335 appearances for the blues.

questions.text: Name the player that kept Kerry Dixon OFF the central striking role for England?
questions.explanation:
Gary Lineker.

	Dixon, although a striker with a phenomenal strike rate was unfortunate to have been playing at a time when there was a wealth of English strikers available to choose from.

questions.text: Peter Osgood, scored two goals on his debut for the club. How many goals did he score in his two spells at Chelsea?
questions.explanation:
150.

	Osgood epitomised the Kings Rd glamour era at Stamford Bridge. He is considered by some as the 'Blues' top striker ever.

questions.text: Perhaps one of the most skillful players ever to put on a Chelsea shirt, this impish Scot left the club in 1988. Who is this Scotsman?
questions.explanation:
Pat Nevin.

	Pat Nevin went on to play at Motherwell, back in his native Scotland.

questions.text: All of these have been Chelsea players except?
questions.explanation:
Carl Hoddle.

	Brother Glen played and managed the blues but Carl remained a Barnet player.

Gordon Durie.

	It is a reference to 'Jukebox Jury', the tv show.

questions.text: Who is the most successful Chelsea captain (trophies) during the 20th century?
questions.explanation:
Dennis Wise.

	Finally, how about this for a Chelsea Dreamteam? 1 Peter Bonetti 2 Ron Harris 3 Marcel Dessai 4 Frank Lebouef 5 Graham Le Saux 6 Glen Hoddle 7 Rudd Hullit 8 Gianfranco Zola 9 Kerry Dixon 10 Gianluca Vialli 11 Peter Osgood ... What a team!
